page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: Our Domesday Project Area around the villages of Upper and Lower Bentley is mainly a{farming}one .The primary land cover in every kilometre square is grassland,some used for actual grazing some cut for silage.Scattered around the area are fields of crops,including cereals and vegetables,and deciduous ofwoodland.The Thrift is the largest area of trees,but this being chopped down.Eventually this will be replaced. {Buildings}in the area are very scattered.Apart from Upper and Lower Bentley and Woodgate,which are small communities with some residential buildings,the remainder are twenty _ eight farms spread across the twelve squares.Thus the region is not higly populated. The only amenities in the area are a{public house}and a small {garden centre}.
